metadata.title: CVE-2013-0312 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
389 Directory Server before 1.3.0.4 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (crash) via a zero length LDAP control sequence.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.0.3-1ubuntu1
389-ds-base - 1.3.0.3-1ubuntu1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.0.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.0.3-1ubuntu1').
